docs.snippet: Oxycodone toxicity and degenerative brain disease were found in an autopsy of Cullen Finnerty, who played for Grand Valley State University....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oxycodone toxicity and degenerative brain disease were found in an autopsy of Cullen Finnerty, who played for Grand Valley State University.
docs.abstract: Autopsy results for Cullen Finnerty, star college quarterback found dead in Michigan woods in late May, reveal that he had chronic traumatic encephalopathy, or CTE,  degenerative brain disease found in the autopsies of several former NFL players; doctors caution against simplistic argument that CTE led to his death, saying autopsy also revealed pneumonia and oxycodone toxicity.

headline.main: Pneumonia Seen as Star’s Cause of Death
headline.print_headline: Pneumonia Is Blamed In Quarterback’s Death
